website_summaries.verdict: The Apogee HDMI 3x1 Mini HD Digital Switcher's power-free design and affordable price tag puts it at the top of HDMI switcher heap--so long as you can live with just three inputs.
pros: Excellent design with a small footprint
cons: lacks custom-installer-friendly features seen on some more expensive switchers

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Apple TV (2nd Gen) and PS3
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive HDMI switch works well to automatically share single HDMI port on TV between Sony PS3 and Apple TV (2nd gen). Note that Apple TV keeps HDMI port active even while in standby. So to support auto-switching make sure ATV is assigned to higher numbered port (lower priority) on HDMI switch. Plugging PS3 into port 1 and Apple TV into port 2 will support auto switching, since PS3 (port 1) overrides ATV (port 2) when the PS3 powers up, and relinquishes control back to the ATV when PS3 powers down.
customer_reviews.author: PeteM

customer_reviews.title: Great For TVs With One HDMI Port
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to hook up a Fire Stick to my kitchen TV, but it only has one HDMI port. I took a chance on this and glad I did. It works as advertised and the remote is very helpful. It's small enough where I can put it out of sight behind the TV. I like the fact that there's no additional power supply needed as I didn't have another outlet available. There is a blue light that comes from the unit which I found distracting with the lights out, so I just covered it up with a small piece of black electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Seems it has been redesigned since the picture shown. Mine had the IR remote sensor integrated in the box, not as a separate dongle. My TV unfortunately only has two HDMI inputs, so I needed a switch to support my new Kindle Fire TV. Since the Fire TV, like an Apple TV, is always "active" on the HDMI port, you just need to plug those kind of devices in a higher numbered port than something like an Xbox that comes and goes. This lets the auto-switching work without needing the remote or the selector button on the box. Anyway - it's inexpensive, it works exactly as I needed it to work, super pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Bad Remote
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item 2 years ago, Works fine except the remote stopped functioning after one year, even with new battery. I bought a new one this past month just for the remote, which turns out only works at a range of about 2 inches from the receiver. I give up on this brand, I'll pay extra for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: I would advise to spend the extra money on a better unit. However
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work very well based on my experience. I would advise to spend the extra money on a better unit. However, I am giving this a 4 star review based on their phenomenal customer service. At first when I received it, it didn't work correctly so they sent me a new replacement unit free of charge. The replacement unit worked better, but not perfect, so I said that I would just prefer a refund. They refunded my money and also said I could keep the other one too.
customer_reviews.author: The Nelsons

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using this switch for about a week but it does exactly what it is supposed to do. I bought it to switch between a ps3 and ps4 on the same tv input and it doesn't skip a beat. Switching is instant and the auto-detect feature works great. There has been a couple comments warning about using this with samsung products but i have been using it with a samsung smart tv and have had no problems at all. The product does what it says and the IR receiver isn't really necessary with the auto detect function
customer_reviews.author: That guy that buys things

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's cheap but sometimes it's better to have something that works
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's cheap but sometimes it's better to have something that works. I almost gave them 2 stars because I was able to reach their customer service and that's admirable but their "help" was to tell me to check with my computer and monitor manufacturers. No thanks, I'll just pay the $30 - $40 for a high-quality HDMI switcher that works. I used Kinivo for my home entertainment center and it worked great. That's probably what I'll go with for the CPU and monitor set up as well. Sometime, trying to save a buck, bites you in the butt!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Nice effective product
customer_reviews.text: I give it four stars because it is very useful for having multiple items plugged into one HDMI port on my television. It is compact and easy to use. I can't give it five stars because i don't like the design of have the ports on opposite sides of the box. The inputs are on the opposite side from the output, so you can't set this on top of a DVD player, table top, etc and manually switch inputs using the button on the box itself. You must hide the box and the cables that are sticking out of both sides behind something. At least the IR extension is quite long and can be used to switch the inputs effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Sothurnboy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: While visiting my nephew, I noticed that he was constantly plugging and unplugging his Xbox, PS3 and TV way too much. Of course, this was because his tv has only one hdmi plug. After seeing his frustration of forgetting to plug this back in...unplug that...I felt there must be a better way. So I logged on to Amazon, entered hdmi switch and found this item. After reading the reviews, I quickly ordered it for him. After arriving, he installed it himself (he's only 10 yrs old) and, viola! the switch automatically picks up the signal and turns on either the Xbox,PS3 or the TV. Could it be any easier for a switch to handle? I think not.
customer_reviews.author: wilfig12

customer_reviews.title: Remote control was defective so it only worked manually. You have to pay for return shipping
customer_reviews.text: The remote control was defective so the product worked only if I walked up to my entertainment center and pushed the buttons manually, . Works with Apple TV 4. To return it you have to pay for your own shipping, probably an important reason why the price is so low. If the new unit that I get in exchange works, then I will give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gutterman

customer_reviews.title: A great solution for extra HDMI ports.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my TV only has 2 HDMI outlets. I have XBOX, Aple TV and my DVR so i need an additional HDMI solution. I plugged my xbox and apple TV into this. if my xbox is on it automatically shows up on the TV and when I switch off the xbox it automatically switches the channel so my Apple TV comes on the screen. Works great. Only downside is the ultra bright blue LED on the top of it. Even when it is hidden behind the TV the glow of that LED is enough to light up the whole wall behind the TV. I just put a piece of tape over it and that solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice switch
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure what happened but I ordered the Apogee switch, but what arrived was a Fosmon brand switch. They look very similar. Anyway, this Fosmon 3x1 switch works really well. My old HDMI switch caused white specs all over the screen and this one does not. Good enough for me, and by the way, it DOES work without a power supply just fine. I have my cable box on one input and my XBOX one on another. Update 2/20/15 Been using the switch for a couple weeks now and no issues whatsoever. The remote works very well also.
customer_reviews.author: B. Allgeier

customer_reviews.title: Great HDMI HDCP capable Switch, but doesn't pass Dishnet 3D.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This HDMI switch works great with no degradation of video and is HDCP capable. It switches HDMI inputs without any blink at all. It has a plug for a Power Supply, but works great without one. (HDMI Powered). Cons: Passes 3D signal from my Blu-Ray 3D player, but not from my Dishnet Hopper. Note: The Dish 3D channels (currently 2) do not show if you can't pass 3D. Otherwise, it's a great, low cost switcher. If you don't watch Dishnet 3D, Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Need additional power supply
customer_reviews.text: Although the write up for this product states that no power supply is required, the unit requires an additional 5vDC power supply to work as an automatic switch and that was not included with the unit or offered as an optional extra, I have not installed it as yet and the instructions state that it will work on manual without the power supply, but since I wanted the option to have it work automatically as well an manually, I will have to scrounge up a power supply somewhere. I would not have ordered this unit if I had realized that it worked this way.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Works terrific.
customer_reviews.text: My parents have their tv mounted above the fireplace and it only has a single HDMI cord running up to it. It's way to difficult to get another run, so I got this so that the satellite box and BR player can both be played. The important thing was having a box that automatically, reliably and easily switched between sources without adding another button for my parents to push. Now, when the turn on the BR player, it shows the BR source, and when they turn it off, it's automatically back to the satellite box.
customer_reviews.author: PeterInCrosby

customer_reviews.title: The switcher worked as advertised for a while. It ...
customer_reviews.text: The switcher worked as advertised for a while. It automatically swapped between the most recent input signal, making switching between devices very convenient. However. within a week of receiving it, sound from any device hooked up to it began to cut in and out. Within a month, video began flickering as well. After three months, it stopped working entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: Needed a multiport HDMI for my TV that only had 1 HDMI input. This item allows me to connect 3 HDMI components to my TV. It comes with a remote control to switch manually between inputs. However, the switcher automatically changes to the component you just powered up or it will change to a component that is still on when you turn a component off. This feature right here is the reason to buy this. Now it is easy for my wife to watch movies on our dvd player because she doesnt have to do anything but turn on the dvd player and the switcher does the rest. no more messing around with the tv inputs.
customer_reviews.author: bh

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This device has worked perfectly for the last couple of months that I have been using it. I needed a switch to connect a third HDMI device to my two-port television. I have a DVR and Blu-Ray player connected to it. By connecting the Blu-Ray in the first port and the DVR in the second port, the switcher automatically changes the input when I turn on the Blu-Ray. I have not noticed any significant picture or audio degradation, but I have not tried directly connecting the Blu-Ray to the television for comparison. The remote is a little flimsy, but I have not had to use it since the automatic switching feature has worked flawlessly thus far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with a price that can't be beat!!!
customer_reviews.text: This HDMI product does a excellent job and works flawlessly. I tried a more expensive hdmi switch that was supposed to change automatically between a dishnetwork hd box and a playstation 3, but it did not. I did some further investigation and discovered that it was not the fault of the switch it is that the dishnetwork box puts out a constant signal even if it is off. That is when I discovered I would need one with a remote unless you would want to keep getting up to change the switch. Another plus is the product can be paired with a logitech harmony remote. One last thing the price is excellent and no power supply is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, with one annoying quality
customer_reviews.text: This switcher works fine, adding an extra HDMI device to my Panny LCD flatscreen. But why do they have to put such a bright blue light on the thing. The bloody thing practically lights up half my living room at night after dark! A little energy vampire that's totally unneeded. Let's see: Why do I need to see a light to know if the device is working? I hate all these bright lights they stick on electronic devices these days, and this is one of the worst. If the light really annoys you, do what I did. Slap a piece of duct tape over it.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: This splitter/switcher is fantastic! Turns out, you don't even need the remote because it senses what you're using for you! We bought this to use on our older (but still great) TV and new WiFi blu-ray player. Whenever we turn the blu-ray player on (even if the TV is still on), this splitter/switcher will change the input on the TV for us automatically. So we don't even have to pull out this little remote! Better than we even imagined!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This little gem worked perfectly! Two of the three HDMI ports went out on our TV. I hooked the switcher to the good port on the TV and plugged the dish receiver, Vizio Bluray player and the Apple TV into the three HDMI outlets on the Apogee. The switcher switches automatically between the three units according to which one is turned on. We couldn't be happier...if you're needing additional ports for whatever reason I highly recommend the Apogee HDMI switcher.
customer_reviews.author: JMK

customer_reviews.title: This works very well in my home. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well in my home. I have an older TV with only 2 HDMI ports, and so far I have 3 hdmi devices. This is a simple plug and play device. Make sure you have one mroe extra hdmi cable lying around though, as this device is only the splitter, remote, and sensor. It automatically switches when it senses a new device has turned on, or you can use the handy remote which comes with the battery installed already. I'm thrilled with the sound and picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: C Barrera

customer_reviews.title: This worked fine until we upgraded our equipment
customer_reviews.text: Although the switch has an input for an AC adapter, none came with the product. No problem until about a month ago when we switched our DirectTV equipment to the Genie. The switch was not sensitive enough to the signal from the Genie to recognize that it needed to switch to that channel and I could not even manually get it to stay on that channel. As a result I disconnected the switch and ended up buying a more expensive, AC powered switch. This switch may do the job for you depending on the equipment you are trying to manage with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Paul

customer_reviews.title: defective unit ?
customer_reviews.text: Remote only worked when within inches of switch. Replaced remote battery to no avail.The battery came out scratched, as if an interior part was out of place. The unit did work when switched manually. Reception to my TV was slightly patchy, but this may have been the fault of a streaming unit which needed driver updates. I have found a way to do away with one HDMI cable and no longer need the switch, but will update this review if I find a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: the image quality on 2 of the 3 inputs is terrible. Inputs #2 & #3 introduce large amounts of ...
customer_reviews.text: This product failed to live up to expectations and falls way short of satisfactory. The remote control function is flaky. You can switch inputs by depressing the remote buttons, but on its own and at random intervals, it switches to another input. Secondly, the image quality on 2 of the 3 inputs is terrible. Inputs #2 & #3 introduce large amounts of digital noise and color artifacts - something nobody's accustomed to seeing when watching HD signals.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ziady

customer_reviews.title: so that piece works great. It's the remote control that is less than ...
customer_reviews.text: Have to click this several times to get it to switch. It's okay. Keeping it because I don't have to switch from my PC to TV mode often. But it's a pain. I actually use it mostly as a way to keep one end of the cable plugged in at all times. I have now found that plugging in my computer when the TV is on creates an automatic switch, so that piece works great. It's the remote control that is less than fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Trish M

customer_reviews.title: good low budget switcher
customer_reviews.text: This switcher works really well for the price, picture and sound quality is unchanged through the device. The only real gripe is when we first power on our cable box we have to turn the cable box back off and on again to get sound occasionally. Switching between inputs is also not instantaneous. If that is not a problem for you then this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: Bought this switcher because I run out of HDMI ports on my TV and both my PS3 and PC worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Skip this; its junk unless you plan to have =>2 devices connected to it always powered on.
customer_reviews.text: This device needs a dedicated power source in order to handle modern devices. PS3 Slim HDMI signal will not pass through this switch unless another device plugged into the switch is also powered on. As a switch for video game consoles this product is useless. Tested with a PS4, a Wii U, a PS3 SLIM, and a Xbox 360: Only Xbox 360 can pass a HDMI signal by itself; the switch needs extra power to supply the signals from the other 3, newer consoles. Spend extra and get a decent switch with external power. Learn from my mistake; You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect HDMI Switch. I have my PS4, Wii U, and PC plugged in to it. I am able to switch back and forth between the equipment much easier now and have had no issues with it at all. I don't mind having the IR plug for the remote, but mainly didn't want a unit that needed power to work. Don't know of many HDMI devices that can't supply enough power to make one of these work anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Adams

customer_reviews.title: Needs power from HDMI port - My Comcast Digital Adapter (Model DC60Xu) does not supply enough.
customer_reviews.text: Our PS/3 supplies plenty of power through its HDMI port to cause the LEDs to light and the remote and manual switch button work fine when it is turned on. But we don't want to leave the PS/3 on all the time and our small Comcast digital adapter doesn't supply enough power to run the switch fully - a 5 volt supply which is not included with the unit is necessary to use the switch when only the Comcast adapter is on.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: easy and inexpensive but flaky audio
customer_reviews.text: This HDMI switcher was easy to install and get working. It's really good for the price. But after being in use for about a month, it regularly loses the audio (i.e., there is no sound delivered on the "active" port). By manually switching to a different port, or by re-selecting the current port, it resets, and all is normal. This pretty much happens anytime when I've not been watching for a few hours; at least once/day. I have also had the audio get a little noisy/garbled while watching. A manual re-select solves it. This doesn't happen very often. Maybe 2-3 times in a month. All-in-all a decent device for the $s. But not without it's warts.
customer_reviews.author: markspace

customer_reviews.title: Saves installing and removing HDMI cables from TV
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Automatically switches inputs from cable box to dvd player, just turn on dvd player and it automatically selects this as input. Turn off the dvd player and it goes back to cable box. No more manually removing and installing cables on back of tv. I was always afraid of damaging the ports on back of the tv. I do not use the included remote, not needed. My wife is very happy as she can switch between units without waiting for me to switch the cables manually. The unit is capable of 3 inputs to 1 tv. I use the cable box, dvd/vcr player and laptop as inputs and it works GREAT and the price is EXCELLENT?
customer_reviews.author: Tarpon

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: I already had a similar product and needed another to connect 3 devices (Blu-ray, Cable and game console) through a single hdmi cable run behind the wall to a mounted tv. This works perfectly, and it automatically switches to the source that is powered on. You can manually switch the source if you have a component that does not power off each time you want to switch the source to the tv. Great product, at a great price. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: jw4

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes these just don't work
customer_reviews.text: A read-through of reviews reveals that sometimes this thing will work, other times it won't. Mine was one of the ones that won't. When connected, mine worked a few minutes with my DVD/VHS combo, and not at all with my new Blu-ray player. After 30 seconds with the combo unit plugged in, I started to see intermittant green flashes, then video worked, then did not work, then worked, then didn't work... and then just stayed not-working. JUNK. Will yours? Ask the fates, and good luck.
customer_reviews.author: W. Mapp

customer_reviews.title: ** Warning ** DoNot Buy. . .
customer_reviews.text: Do Not buy this device because it does not support copy protection HDMI so your TiVo won't work through this switch nor will the Fire TV playing Amazon Prime instant video. I haven't even tried the Apple TV even though others claim it works. probably because a few years back Apple did away with digital rights management. At least it was only a ten dollar loss. not even worth my time to return it. Recycle bin here we come.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Awesome value.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much for the price, but the little guy works. The only problem I have is that it will auto switch to my DVD if I power it on, but it won't auto switch back to my DVR once the DVD is off. And I haven't figured out how to make my Harmony remote work with it yet. But that's probably more my fault than the product. I'm sure there are nicer ones out there for 4x the price. But I am happy with this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius

customer_reviews.title: All have failed in less than two months
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these, and all were fine for a month. Now, over the course of my second month, all have failed. All 3 have at least one bad HDMI port, and now all 3 no longer work with HDCP devices like a PS3, Blu-ray player or DirecTV DVR. These are junk, and the fact that they work fine for a month means nothing. They will quit working in short order.
customer_reviews.author: arrowrand

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This item was great, Better then I thought it would be. I have a DVD, Xbox 360, and Direct TV DVR. all hooked to it. You can use the remote to change input or the button on the box, Or even better. I normally have the DVR on and if I want to play the Xbox, I just turn the xbox on and it will automatically switch to the xbox and when you turn the xbox off it will switch back to the DVR without touching it. It is great. Power is not needed for this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Beaner

customer_reviews.title: I was sceptical.
customer_reviews.text: I wont lie.. I didn't think this would work for the price. Took 5 minutes to set up and i don't even need the remote. It automatically selects the input as you turn on the device. The remote works well though. Using with a new Xbox360 and PC hooked to a old 62in Toshiba TV. One HDMI didn't work on TV leaving me with a single HDMI port. You need a quick cheap solution to a lack of HDMI ports? Do it up!
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Remote Stinks, Auto-switching Stinks
customer_reviews.text: When you switch using the button on the unit, it works perfectly. Good sound quality, good picture quality. In my experience it does not auto-switch correctly between a cable box and a Roku box. I'm only using two inputs. Worse of all, though, the remote does not work reliably. It goes through batteries like crazy -- within 1 week of installing a brand-new battery, the battery will be dead and the remote will stop working. This is with minimal use. Replacing the battery restores it to functionality for another week. This is a deal-breaker, and unfortunately, I'm past the return period for this switcher. I'll be looking for another switcher with a better remote.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Apogee 3x1 that I've purchased. It does what it claims, switches fast, no electrical hookup, turn one unit off it switches to the next united (line 1, 2, or 3)--no need to do anything. Adds more HDMI outlets to a tv just for a few bucks and not the extreme expense of buying a tv with extra built in connections. I never use the remote--don't need to!
customer_reviews.author: therapist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I love the auto-switching function. I haven't had it for very long, so I cannot comment on longevity. I have no use for the remote or IR sensor, so I don't now if those work. I'm very puzzled as to why it came with a connection for a power supply as these items don't need it. Overall, this is perfect. I love the small size.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Delos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great 3x1 HDMI Mini-Switcher
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT and very cool little product. It provides reliable switching between 3 HDMI sources and the destination device/TV, with no apparent loss in signal quality. Switching appears to be very reliable, either via the manual on-box button, or via the cool little remote (and infrared sensor). Not this devices' fault, but auto-switching is not always effective, as some HDMI devices always remain ON, so this device cannot automatically tell which device you want to use, when you turn a specific device ON.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This thing works just as advertised. Only switching the output from a "home theater computer" and DVD player recorder. Switches automatically, no need for the remote. Gets its power from the HDMI cable, no need for external power. Tucked away neatly behind the TV. I like it so much I'm ordering another one for another TV that doesn't have enough HDMI inputs. Great price, great product, fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I saw there were quite a few mixed reviews on this switcher but I figured for the price I would give it a go and was not disappointed. It works well; I have it hooked up to my XBox 360 and PS3 and I have had no problems with picture or sound. Just need to remember to power off one when going to the other; standby mode kind of messes things up.
customer_reviews.author: Amar Rhom

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little piece of technology
customer_reviews.text: This switcher was fairly simple to install and only took about five minutes. It makes for very easy switching to use the TV as a giant computer monitor, such as when viewing photos online. It doesn't interfere with functioning of any electronic equipment. The remote makes it easy to use, though it would be nice to have it bigger so it wouldn't get misplaced (or fall between the couch cushions) so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Radar626Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great little switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this switch because I ran out of HDMI inputs from my TV :-(. This switch creates two extra inputs for me. No power required, the best part is this switch will switch to the input that is active, so I don't need to switch input manually. The only problem is that the LED light is extremely bright, if it's not in your bedroom shouldn't be any problem.
customer_reviews.author: NJer

customer_reviews.title: so it was too late to return it for a refund when I realized that it was not a good product. At 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked 80% of the time for 7 months, but was never reliable. Return window is one month, so it was too late to return it for a refund when I realized that it was not a good product. At 7 months, it stopped working completely. Even at $11, it was not worth the aggravation. Find another brand of HDMI switch.
customer_reviews.author: ma

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: Love this switch. I use it to hook up my Verizon fios box and my pc to my projector.Works great. Only draw back is if I am watching tv and I turn on my pc, it switches to the pc. But it won't do that if I am on my pc and turn on the Fios box. Minor flew that by no means is a deal breaker. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bassman

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with my Direct TV Genie
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would work, the DVD player source worked, but the Direct TV genie would not work. Received an Error message on the TV screen, can't reacll what it is now, but basically said it was an incompatible signal. I can only assume it was signal degradation. So it did not work for me, but looks like many others have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bofessional

customer_reviews.title: My perfect switcher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this switcher to replace a Monoprice switcher that couldn't resolve handshaking issues with either my Xbox 360 and my WDTV and was almost 3x the cost. I figured for the price I couldn't really go wrong. Installation took about 2 minutes, fired up my HDMI devices and all worked perfectly. The Auto-Detect works like a champ making the remote unnecessary, I didn't even bother to to hook up the IR detector. Great product if you're short on HDMI ports!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This item did not work for me at all. I got it set up and as other have stated it needs some power. It would be nice for them to at least state the size of adapter that could be used with it in the information sheet. I kept the item thinking eventually I would get an adapter but it is just too much trouble to even find.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne P

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Item is working well. It does not auto switch like it's suppossed to do. Mine did not come with a power cord so I'm not sure if it needs power to auto switch. The remote works ok. The remote reciver comes with mounthing tape & I mounted it out of sight. The qulaitly of the signal had not been reduced, the picture on my TV from cable & my PS3 still looks great.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has one annoying quirk.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well enough. It allows three HDMI inputs to share one input without have to unplug and plug in each cable. The problem the device has is that it will randomly switch to one of the other even if none of the other devices are on. It will switch while I'm playing a game, or watching a movie, which can get very annoying. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone because of this flaw. Spend a little more money and get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerX

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!  Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Kinivo 501BN which was great but would shut down randomly. This was 25% of the price and works great. Switching between my HTPC, a Tivo and an XBOX 360. Paired up with a Harmony 650 remote and I was all set. Had to manually train the buttons as none of the suggestions from the comments worked for me but it was simple and now my system is rock solid.

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: When I discovered this product I was excited to find such a simple and inexpensive solution to switching HDMI between my cable box and DVD player. Unfortunately, the unit did not work. Cables were connected correctly, the corresponding unit lights lit when I switched through the output choices but my TV never received a signal using the switcher. I came back to the Amazon website and began reading the reviews from several others who encountered the same problem. Bottom line? If you order this item you're taking a gamble on receiving a properly operating HDMI switcher. Don't they test these things at the factory?

I switched out my DVD player to a Sony (DVP-SR510H) that does turn off its output, so now I can switch between it ant the Roku by turning the DVD player on and off.

After setup, I found that the switch will automatically select the source it receives a signal from - which means you really don't even need the remote. The remote is useful, however, if you want to switch between sources when more than one of the signals is coming through.

product_meta.title: Apogee HDMI 3x1 Mini Switcher - No power supply needed
product_meta.description: Length:3-PortThe 3x1 HDMI mini switcher routes high definition video (in multiple resolutions up to 1080p) and digital audio from any one of the three sources to display unit. Three inputs accommodate the simultaneous connection of up to three high definition video sources, such as satellite systems and HD DVD players. The output sends the high definition audio/video signals to a high definition display. Aside from the manual switching, the switching can also done via the IR remote that is provided with the unit for added convenience. The compact design eliminates the bulk of an HDMI switcher while still having the same functionality.
feature_bullets: No power supply needed. External IR receiver base w/ remote
Switch easily between any three HDMI sources
